description:
Google's known for our innovative technologies, products and services -- and for the people behind them. As the Director of Process Design and Technology, it will be your mission to create an infrastructure that makes people processes seamless for the People Operations team and all Googlers. You are an experienced operations expert that will help to accomplish this mission by creating a vision and strategy for the process design team and leading them to success. Working with our internal Corporate Engineering team, you’ll be responsible for developing a multi-year technology roadmap and managing a technology portfolio that creates internal process innovations and leads the team, and Google, to success.

Great just isn't good enough for our People Operations team (you probably know us better as "Human Resources"). Made up of equal parts HR professionals, former consultants and analysts, we're the advocates of Google's colorful culture. In People Ops, we "find them, grow them, and keep them" - we bring the world's most innovative people to Google and provide the programs that help them thrive. Whether recruiting the next great Googler, refining our core programs, developing talent or simply looking for ways to inject some more fun into the lives of our Googlers, we bring a data-driven approach that is reinventing the human resources field.
eeo: At Google, we don’t just accept difference—we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing this form.
qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • 10 years of people management experience.
  • Experience with technology implementation for both first and third party systems.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Master's degree or PhD in Industrial Engineering, Operations Design or Business Administration.
  • Experience in an analytical function and/or strategy consulting.
  • Project management experience.
  • Knowledge of Lean and/or process design principles.
  • Knowledge of HR services and operations function.
  • Excellent communication, organization and documentation skills.
responsibilities:
• Manage a high performing team of Process Design Project Managers and Analysts responsible for the People Operations technology portfolio.
  • Leverage your knowledge of HR services and operations to set a vision for the team and influence our multi-year technology roadmap, including influencing stakeholders across People Operations to redesign current processes.
  • Manage projects through all phases, from diagnostic to implementation, across large cross-functional/cross-regional teams, including Engineering and People Operations. Determine business impact.
  • Assemble and lead steering committees to vet and prioritize future projects based on impact. Influence relevant stakeholders to prioritize cross company impact.
  • Develop business requirements for new systems and work with software engineering teams to implement throughout the development lifecycle. Manage large scale third party integrations and ongoing system upgrades, testing, new functionality launches, and configurations.
title: Director, Process Design and Technology
